['', 'We prefer candidates based in Santa Monica, San Francisco or Seattle, but would consider candidates elsewhere who are able to work Pacific time zone hours.', 'You are excited to build software that is used by other software developers and the operations teams that support them, enabling enterprises to focus on their core business.', 'Full Time/ Part Time: ', 'test-driven development', 'Professional experience with relevant domains, such as distributed systems, API design, and networking', 'Tight feedback loops', 'About', 'Professional experience as part of a cross-functional team, or a Computer Science degree', 'Subcategory: ', 'Experience: ', 'We have separate teams for building our new products and maintaining our older ones. Most engineers rotate between those teams on a regular basis, in order to learn from and contribute to both efforts.', 'Ability to research problems (including making incremental progress when faced with technical ambiguity) and break them into discrete parts', 'Professional experience with our technologies and processes (Ruby, Go, Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry, Linux systems, Agile, Test Driven Development, XP)Professional experience with relevant domains, such as distributed systems, API design, and networkingOn-call experience with production-grade systemsInterested in working in diverse and highly collaborative environmentsContribution to thriving open source communitiesFamiliarity with common development tools/stacks, such as Unix, command-line interfaces, and CI/CD systems and practices', 'Tight feedback loops drive our processes. We value test-driven development, pair programming, retrospectives, continuous integration, and working at a sustainable pace. We nurture psychological safety within teams and empower them to drive the changes necessary to obtain successful outcomes. We build software and solve problems collaboratively. Teammates are always accessible to lend a helping hand both remotely and in-person.', 'Professional experience with our technologies and processes (Ruby, Go, Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry, Linux systems, Agile, Test Driven Development, XP)', 'You are excited to build software that is used by other software developers and the operations teams that support them, enabling enterprises to focus on their core business.You are interested in networking, as the application developer sees it. That means wiring up applications to each other and enabling them to consume services over the network.You are a strong collaborator and actively foster safe and inclusive teams. You enjoy mentoring others as much as you like learning from them. You’re experienced with pair programming or excited to try it out.', 'Category : ', 'retrospectives', 'You are a strong collaborator and actively foster safe and inclusive teams. You enjoy mentoring others as much as you like learning from them. You’re experienced with pair programming or excited to try it out.', 'continuous integration', 'Posted Date:', 'pair programming', 'Ability to dive into large codebases and contribute as you learn', 'sustainable pace', 'Work From Home: ', 'We provide a premier application deployment experience for enterprise software developers, and this year we’re bringing that experience to Kubernetes.', 'psychological safety', 'Tanzu portfolio', 'Contribution to thriving open source communities', 'Interested in working in diverse and highly collaborative environments', 'Our group is part of VMware’s new Modern Applications Business Unit (MAPBU). Our Tanzu portfolio helps customers build, run, and manage their most important applications. We provide a premier application deployment experience for enterprise software developers, and this year we’re bringing that experience to Kubernetes.', 'You are interested in networking, as the application developer sees it. That means wiring up applications to each other and enabling them to consume services over the network.', 'Interested? Here is what we look for:', 'You’re a life-long learner. You like learning new programming languages and technologies and you’re flexible about which ones you use.', 'Familiarity with common development tools/stacks, such as Unix, command-line interfaces, and CI/CD systems and practices', 'Our teams provide network connectivity solutions for products across the Tanzu Portfolio including the Tanzu Application Service, a commercial offering of the Cloud Foundry project used by some of the largest enterprises and governments around the world. We build and maintain network proxies, container networking implementations, and distributed control planes for our VM-based and Kubernetes-based systems. We work with Go, Ruby, YAML (yes, YAML!), Kubernetes, and various open-source projects.', 'The following are attributes we see in successful candidates, but they are not “requirements.Professional experience as part of a cross-functional team, or a Computer Science degreeAbility to dive into large codebases and contribute as you learnAbility to research problems (including making incremental progress when faced with technical ambiguity) and break them into discrete partsProfessional experience with our technologies and processes (Ruby, Go, Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry, Linux systems, Agile, Test Driven Development, XP)Professional experience with relevant domains, such as distributed systems, API design, and networkingOn-call experience with production-grade systemsInterested in working in diverse and highly collaborative environmentsContribution to thriving open source communitiesFamiliarity with common development tools/stacks, such as Unix, command-line interfaces, and CI/CD systems and practicesVMware is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that will consider all qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.Category : Engineering and TechnologySubcategory: Software EngineeringExperience: Manager and ProfessionalFull Time/ Part Time: Full TimeWork From Home: NoPosted Date: 2020-08-28VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.', 'On-call experience with production-grade systems', 'VMware is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that will consider all qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.', 'Ability to dive into large codebases and contribute as you learnAbility to research problems (including making incremental progress when faced with technical ambiguity) and break them into discrete parts']

['', 'Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Economics, Management or other quantitative discipline fields with a strong academic record.', 'Experience with one or more higher-level JVM-based data processing tools such as Beam, Dataflow, Spark or Flink.', 'Experience scheduling, structuring, and owning data transformation jobs that span multiple systems and have high requirements for volume handled, duration, or timing.', 'Provide consulting to application and data engineering organizations on best practices for designing applications to enable easy analytics; be an expert on large-scale data processing.', 'Prior data infrastructure experience in support to a Service driven organization is a plus but not essential.', 'A true expert on big data, comfortable working with datasets of varying latencies and size and disparate platforms.', 'Prior projects working with optimizing storage and access of high volume heterogeneous data with distributed systems such as Hadoop, including familiarity with various data storage mediums and the tradeoffs of each', 'Who You Are', ' A true expert on big data, comfortable working with datasets of varying latencies and size and disparate platforms. Excited about unlocking the valuable data hidden in inaccessible raw tables and logs. Attentive to detail and with a relentless focus on accuracy. Excited to collaborate with partners in business reporting and engineering to determine the source of truth of key business metrics. ', 'Interest in implementing security best practices.', 'About Puppet', 'A team player—who is collaborative and enjoys learning from and sharing knowledge with other developers in a team environment.', "Visa Sponsorship Please note, this position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.About PuppetPuppet's core mission is to eliminate soul crushing work. We created the industry standard for managing infrastructure as code. And we didn't stop there—our product portfolio has grown to help organizations automate across their entire software delivery lifecycle. With more than two-thirds of Fortune 100 companies using Puppet's open source or commercial products, our code is helping power thousands of organizations across the world.As the industry leader in DevOps solutions, we realize that our success is a collective effort; all made possible by the incredible people working here, our customers, partners, and Puppet community. Our culture is built on positivity, diversity, inclusivity and support—and we seek people who are resilient, entrepreneurial-minded, team players who continually strive to be incrementally better every single day. In our work together we aim to be curious, accountable, empathetic and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like the environment you'd thrive in, why not say hello?Learn more about Puppet by checking out the values we live by and the awesome benefits and perks we offer employees!Puppet is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact +1-877-575-9775 for assistance.Please see Puppet's privacy policy here.PM16", 'Curious—with a drive to learn and understand.', 'Broad technical experience and up-to-date industry knowledge, with ability to evaluate new solutions as they arise', 'Be on the forefront for the development of the next generation of capabilities that will enable our customers to meet their automation demands while taking Puppet to the next level.', 'Sr. Software Engineer ']

Minimum 2 years of experience with zSeries/Operating Systems (z/OS) development, test and support techniques Proficient at debugging skills using tools such as IPCS Experience with Agile Software Development Basic z/OS administration knowledge.Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise Minimum 5 years’ experience in z/OS test, support or development, z/OS system programming, z/OS Assembler and PL/X Deep z/OS administration knowledge.About Business UnitIBM Systems helps IT leaders think differently about their infrastructure. IBM servers and storage are no longer inanimate - they can understand, reason, and learn so our clients can innovate while avoiding IT issues. Our systems power the world’s most important industries and our clients are the architects of the future. Join us to help build our leading-edge technology portfolio designed for cognitive business and optimized for cloud computing.Your Life @ IBMWhat matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.Location StatementIBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for this position now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for this position, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.Being You @ IBMIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. job_title: Staff Embedded Software Engineer: Cybersecurity / Functional Safety
job_text: [' Knowledge of ARM-based Embedded System Experience in Open Source Linux development Experience in Linux Kernel and Driver development for Embedded Systems Experience in Linux and Bare Metal Application development Source management experience with GIT Excellent communication skills, both written and oral Team Player, Well Organized and Willingness to travel Ability to work in fast paced and fun multitasking environment', ' Experience in Security/Cybersecurity Applications is desired, but not required', ' Team Player, Well Organized and Willingness to travel', 'Description', 'Staff Embedded Software Engineer: Cybersecurity / Functional Safety', ' Knowledge of other Embedded OS such as RTOS Knowledge of symmetric and asymmetric multi-processing systems and standards such as openAMP Knowledge of Embedded Hypervisors Knowledge of Trusted Execution Environment Knowledge of ARM Trustzone Technology Experience in Functional Safety Applications (i.e. ISO26262, IEC61508 or DO-178/254) is desired, but not required Experience in Security/Cybersecurity Applications is desired, but not required', 'Responsibilities', ' Experience in Functional Safety Applications (i.e. ISO26262, IEC61508 or DO-178/254) is desired, but not required', 'One Or More Of The Following', ' Work hands-on in developing software applications', ' Knowledge of symmetric and asymmetric multi-processing systems and standards such as openAMP', ' Experience in Linux and Bare Metal Application development', ' Excellent communication skills, both written and oral', "Staff Embedded Software Engineer: Cybersecurity / Functional Safety158893San Jose, CA, United StatesJul 30, 2020 DescriptionJob DescriptionAt Xilinx, we are leading the industry transformation to build an adaptable, intelligent world. ARE YOU bold, collaborative, and creative? At Xilinx, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to revolutionize the world of technology. We believe that by embracing diverse ideas, pushing boundaries, and working together as ONEXILINX, anything is possible.Our culture of innovation began with the invention of the Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA), and with the 2018 introduction of our Adaptive Compute Acceleration Platform (ACAP), has made a quantum leap in capability, solidifying our role as the adaptable platform supplier of choice. From the start, we have always believed in providing inventors with products and platforms that are infinitely adaptable. From self-driving cars, to world-record genome processing, to AI and big data, to the world's first 5G networks, we empower the world's builders and visionaries whose ideas solve every day problems and enhance people's lives.If you are PASSIONATE, ADAPTABLE, and INNOVATIVE, Xilinx is the right place for you! At Xilinx we care deeply about creating meaningful development experiences while building a strong sense of belonging and connection. We foster an environment of empowered learning, wellness, community engagement, and recognition, so you can focus on work that matters - world class technology that improves the way we live and work. We are ONEXILINX.The Core Vertical Markets Engineering team is a fast paced and dynamic group with a charter to deliver high quality “go to market” collateral and solutions such as Reference Designs, IP, Application Notes and Documentation targeting Cybersecurity and Functional Safety applications across all markets.We are looking for a candidate with good experience and strong skills in Embedded Software development. The target platform the candidate will work on includes the Zynq UltraScale+ SoC and state-of-the-art Adaptive Compute Acceleration Platform (ACAP). Experience in Functional Safety and/or Cybersecurity is desired, but not required.Responsibilities Define market requirements for next generation platforms and solutions Develop software components of reference design development with SoCs and ensure quality and on-time delivery Work cross-functionally with marketing and other engineering groups to architect reference designs/framework solution that meets or exceed customer requirements Work hands-on in developing software applications Participate and resolve critical customer support cases Develop and review critical customer facing documentation (User Guides, Application Notes, White Papers) to enhance user experience#mhJob QualificationsBS with 8+ years of exp or MS with 6+ years of exp or PhD with 3+ years of exp in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related equivalent Knowledge of ARM-based Embedded System Experience in Open Source Linux development Experience in Linux Kernel and Driver development for Embedded Systems Experience in Linux and Bare Metal Application development Source management experience with GIT Excellent communication skills, both written and oral Team Player, Well Organized and Willingness to travel Ability to work in fast paced and fun multitasking environmentOne Or More Of The Following Knowledge of other Embedded OS such as RTOS Knowledge of symmetric and asymmetric multi-processing systems and standards such as openAMP Knowledge of Embedded Hypervisors Knowledge of Trusted Execution Environment Knowledge of ARM Trustzone Technology Experience in [' ', '', 'Deep knowledge of at least one programming language ecosystem (e.g. Python, Scala, Go) ', 'Senior Data Engineer', 'Preferred Qualifications', "At our company, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, our company is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.Senior Data EngineerCommercial Launchpad helps push the Commercial Bank forward by incubating new ideas and accelerating strategic initiatives. We are a diverse, balanced and fearless team of designers, product managers, data scientists, engineers & strategists — working together to solve complex problems across the Commercial Bank. We move fast, we have the freedom to take risks, both in the ways we approach problems and the tools we use.Keep reading if:You embrace change and innovation, always seeking to push the boundaries, are comfortable with challenging the status-quo, and thrive in ambiguity.You LOVE technology and learning new things.What we’re looking for:Amazing technical instincts. You know how to evaluate and choose the right technology and approach for the job. You have stories you could share about what problem you thought you were solving at first, but through testing and iteration, came to solve a much bigger and better problem that resulted in positive outcomes all-around.A love for learning. Technology is continually evolving around us, and you want to keep up to date to ensure we are using the right tech at the right time.Confidence, not ego. You have an ability to collaborate with others and see all sides of the coin to come to the best solution for everyone.Demonstrated experience in the open source, big data ecosystem.What you'll do:As the data engineering technical lead within Launchpad, you’ll be working collaboratively with some of our brightest engineering talent to solve challenging, high impact business problems using data. You will be evaluating, installing, configuring, and deploying software; you will be writing code and use thoughtful engineering practices to test it, deploy it, and run it. We are a part of a larger organization, so we will rely on your ability to get things done through others.All of our infrastructure runs on AWS. Currently we use Airflow, PySpark, NiFi, Kafka, Flink for stream processing. We store data in Parquet and use databases such as Cassandra, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redshift and Snowflake. We do analytics using H2O, Spark and MLlib, Databricks/EMR, TensorFlow. We build awesome products for our users that use this data. We write microservices in Go and Node.js, orchestrated by Kubernetes, with user experiences written in React and TypeScript. Your hands-on expertise in at least some of these tools will be valuable, as well as your track record of providing effective technical guidance.Basic QualificationsAt least 3 years of experience in software engineering inclusive of source control, agile practices, testing, CI/CD and design principlesAt least 3 years data engineering experience that includes Ingestion, Transformation, Storage, Query, or Analytics open source toolsPreferred Qualifications", 'Keep reading if:', "What you'll do:", 'Deep knowledge of at least one programming language ecosystem (e.g. Python, Scala, Go) Practical experience with data modeling (e.g. dimensional modeling, temporal modeling, OLAP)', 'Practical experience with data modeling (e.g. dimensional modeling, temporal modeling, OLAP)', 'What we’re looking for:', 'Basic Qualifications']

job_text: ['Position Summary... ', 'Manages small to medium-sized complex team projects by reviewing and understanding project requirements; translating requirements into technical solutions; researching and identifying alternative solutions; determining needed solutions based on return on investment and value add to the business; gathering needed information (for example, design documents, product requirements, wire frames); writing and developing code; communicating status and issues to appropriate team members and stakeholders; collaborating with project team and cross-functional teams; identifying areas of opportunity; interpreting information and identifying a solution; ensuring solution is sustainable across implementation and use; and ensuring on-time delivery and hand-offs.', 'Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.', " What you'll do...Manages small to medium-sized complex team projects by reviewing and understanding project requirements; translating requirements into technical solutions; using the Open Door Policy; and demonstrating and assisting others with how to apply these in executing business processes and practices. ['Five (5) to eight (8) years of practical experience in network and vulnerability analysis preferred.', 'The specific purpose of this EITaaS Pilot is to partner with industry to reform existing and future Army IT operations and services delivery through commercial services in order to increase Army readiness, mission effectiveness and IT user efficiencies, and establish standardized, innovative IT services.', 'Knowledge of IT security will be an advantage.', 'Experience and understanding of various network/monitoring tools Clearance Level:', 'Junior to Mid-level Network Engineer (Subject Matter Expert-SME) position supporting a DoD Program Executive Office (PEO) providing Enterprise IT as a Service (EITaaS) through the Integrated Product Office (IPO). The ideal candidate will have a proven background in enterprise-wide Information Technology (IT) solutions, Network Support, and Cyber initiatives. The candidate will work supporting the Technical Management Division (TMD) Director within the Program Management Office (PMO) of the IPO and have a demonstrated ability to provide strategic level advice and guidance to help shape scalable technical acquisition approaches. Job Duties:', 'Provides authoritative technical and programmatic advice and guidance on the full range of network operations and management, system operation, new technology evaluation and deployment, and user support.', 'As the Army drives towards its 2028 Modernization Strategy and postures to the era of great power competition put forth in the National Defense Strategy, we must operate and defend our networks ruthlessly. The Armys communications network is the foundational weapons platform for the entire force. All Army operations depend on timely, reliable delivery and transmission of data. Today, the Army owns and operates its entire IT network and long- distance communications. This model produces slow rates of change and technology adoption that diverges from similar commercial offerings.', 'Develops and implements Information Technology (IT), Network and Telecommunication requirements as articulated by Program Officer, Technical Division (TMD) Director or Authorizing Official Representatives and provides guidance and recommends metric driven network analysis/comparisons for meeting them.', 'The Army is exploring a new approach for delivering enterprise network and core IT services: Enterprise Information Technology as a Service (EITaaS). The EITaaS pilot will assess the feasibility to deploy commercial solutions for data transport, end-user services, and collaborative data environments for selected Army installations.', 'Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) and proficient in Microsoft Office Applications.', 'Active Secret Security Clearance required; Top Secret preferred Travel:', 'As the Army drives towards its 2028 Modernization Strategy and postures to the era of great power competition put forth in the National Defense Strategy, we must operate and defend our networks ruthlessly. The Armys communications network is the foundational weapons platform for the entire force. All Army operations depend on timely, reliable delivery and transmission of data. Today, the Army owns and operates its entire IT network and long- distance communications. This model produces slow rates of change and technology adoption that diverges from similar commercial offerings.The Army is exploring a new approach for delivering enterprise network and core IT services: Enterprise Information Technology as a Service (EITaaS). The EITaaS pilot will assess the feasibility to deploy commercial solutions for data transport, end-user services, and collaborative data environments for selected Army installations.The specific purpose of this EITaaS Pilot is to partner with industry to reform existing and future Army IT operations and services delivery through commercial services in order to increase Army readiness, mission effectiveness and IT user efficiencies, and establish standardized, innovative IT services.Junior to Mid-level Network Engineer (Subject Matter Expert-SME) position supporting a DoD Program Executive Office (PEO) providing Enterprise IT as a Service (EITaaS) through the Integrated Product Office (IPO). The ideal candidate will have a proven background in enterprise-wide Information Technology (IT) solutions, Network Support, and Cyber initiatives. The candidate will work supporting the Technical Management Division (TMD) Director within the Program Management Office (PMO) of the IPO and have a demonstrated ability to provide strategic level advice and guidance to help shape scalable technical acquisition approaches. Job Duties:Conducts technical reviews of contractor IT related proposals and provides recommendations concerning contractor proposals including concepts, architecture, integration of Cybersecurity requirements, and Cybersecurity risk assessment activities.Provides authoritative technical and programmatic advice and guidance on the full range of network operations and management, system operation, new technology evaluation and deployment, and user support.Defines customer requirements for new and modified systems and services based upon analysis of business needs and practices.Develops and implements Information Technology (IT), Network and Telecommunication requirements as articulated by Program Officer, Technical Division (TMD) Director or Authorizing Official Representatives and provides guidance and recommends metric driven network analysis/comparisons for meeting them.Advises on contractor IT related issues such as budget planning, project coordination and architecture.Perform a variety of functions on a wide range of information management (IM) and information technology (IT) issues.Stays current in the latest information security and risk management knowledge, including new and emerging threats and vulnerabilities.Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) and proficient in Microsoft Office Applications.Ability to work effectively in a leadership-type role with minimal supervision and ability to proactively engage with and advise government and contractor support.Participate in Configuration Control Boards or Integrated Product Team (IPTs) as well as Prepare documentation and present reports. Qualifications:Five (5) to eight (8) years of practical experience in network and vulnerability analysis preferred.Familiar with the primary functions of networking equipment, i.e. Routers, Switches, Firewalls, and wide area communications.Awareness of some of the following vendor products; Cisco, Aruba, Software Defined Networking, Latest WAN technologies (Microsoft Express Route Technologies), Cloud compute and storage solutions.Knowledge of IT security will be an advantage.Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.Working under pressure, multitasking between simultaneous projects and responding to deadlines.Flexible, tenacious, highly self-motivated, and committed to achieving goals.Experience and understanding of various network/monitoring tools Clearance Level:Active Secret Security Clearance required; Top Secret preferred Travel:Minimal, approximately 15-20%. Benefits:Health, Dental, Vision, 401K Matching, AD&D Insurance EEO Employer F/M/Vet/Disabled', 'Health, Dental, Vision, 401K Matching, AD&D Insurance EEO Employer F/M/Vet/Disabled', 'Advises on contractor IT related issues such as budget planning, project coordination and architecture.', 'Participate in Configuration Control Boards or Integrated Product Team (IPTs) as well as Prepare documentation and present reports. Qualifications:', 'Familiar with the primary functions of networking equipment, i.e. Routers, Switches, Firewalls, and wide area communications.', 'Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.', 'Minimal, approximately 15-20%. Benefits:', 'Awareness of some of the following vendor products; Cisco, Aruba, Software Defined Networking, Latest WAN technologies (Microsoft Express Route Technologies), Cloud compute and storage solutions.', 'Defines customer requirements for new and modified systems and services based upon analysis of business needs and practices.', 'Conducts technical reviews of contractor IT related proposals and provides recommendations concerning contractor proposals including concepts, architecture, integration of Cybersecurity requirements, and Cybersecurity risk assessment activities.', 'Working under pressure, multitasking between simultaneous projects and responding to deadlines.', 'Stays current in the latest information security and risk management knowledge, including new and emerging threats and vulnerabilities.', 'Flexible, tenacious, highly self-motivated, and committed to achieving goals.', 'Perform a variety of functions on a wide range of information management (IM) and information technology (IT) issues.', 'Ability to work effectively in a leadership-type role with minimal supervision and ability to proactively engage with and advise government and contractor support.']

['', "By becoming the source of truth for our customers' data, we're helping them make better decisions and be more effective. We’re looking for a mobile applications engineer to help us build a React Native mobile-first experience for our tool.", "As an early member of the company, you’ll have a chance to shape how we grow, making key decisions around technical choices, and defining our culture. We're working to build a sustainable environment where excellence sits alongside a recognition we operate in a system and a need to nurture learning at all levels.", 'IMPORTANT: In order to be considered for this position please submit your application to BeApplied using the following link', 'As the first member of our team working on a mobile product, you’ll help us build a rich and fully-featured tool on both Android and iOS using React Native that gives our users a smooth, seamless experience. You’ll work with our infrastructure team to define the mobile development toolchain, and work with technical leadership to make key foundational design decisions that will guide us for the years to come. You’ll work with our product team to define what it means to put Proton on a mobile device.', 'https://app.beapplied.com/apply/d6tsqcex9k?utm_source=linkedin', "At Proton we're bringing cutting-edge technology to the world of business-to-business distribution. It's a large market that offers an enormous opportunity for growth. The industry we serve accounts for trillions of dollars of revenue a year. It's a huge chance to have an impact by shaking up an industry that's still waking up to the promise of technology. We have a chance to really transform the way a huge number of people work for the better, and bridge the gap between amazing software tools and human expertise.", 'Our existing server-side infrastructure runs in a microservice architecture orchestrated by Kubernetes. Our backend is written in Python and Go, and our frontend is developed in JavaScript using the Vue framework. Our mobile experience will be built using the React Native framework, targeting Android and iOS. We plan to expand our development toolchain, including a robust continuous integration layer, to support our mobile vision.', 'This engineering role sits within our user products team, joining engineering functions in server-side, machine learning, and frontend development. It reports to our CTO.', 'We think big and start small: you’ll also need to be nimble as we try and refine our mobile product, while not losing sight of the long-term goal. We want to build a true mobile-first application, including features such as on-device machine learning, that may require some diving into platform-native SDKs.']

job_text: ['', '10 years of firmware development experience with C/C++. ', 'Experience working with microprocessors or similar. ', 'Development for a med device working from a low power microprocessor. ', 'Good Project Management skills. ', 'Leads software development efforts from pre-concept to production for medical devices. Development for a med device working from a low power microprocessor. ', '\xa0', 'Understanding of electronics components, systems and circuit design. ', 'Responsibilities: ', '\xa0Requirements and ', 'Experience with Bluetooth Low Energy protocols and driver development. ', ' ', 'Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Engineering discipline ', 'Oversees creation and deployment of software test tools with contract manufacturing. ', 'Extensive experience in medical device or biotech space ', 'Strong object-oriented programming and design skills. ', 'Experience with Medical Device Development Life Cycle and Manufacturing. ', 'OUR CLIENT CANNOT PROVIDE SPONSORSHIP OR WORK CORP TO CORP.\xa0 ', 'Experience with FDA QSR 21 CFR Part 820 and ISO 13485. This role will be responsible for leading the software development process from concept through architecture, development and verification for electronic Medical Devices. Ideal candidate will have excellent software engineer skills and strong scientific and regulatory knowledge. ', 'Experience in writing control software for test equipment. ', 'Desired Experience:', 'Strong mathematical skills and understanding of data processing. ', 'Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Engineering discipline Extensive experience in medical device or biotech space Good Project Management skills. Experience with Medical Device Development Life Cycle and Manufacturing. Experience with FDA QSR 21 CFR Part 820 and ISO 13485. 10 years of firmware development experience with C/C++. Experience with Bluetooth Low Energy protocols and driver development. Experience working with microprocessors or similar. Strong object-oriented programming and design skills. Understanding of electronics components, systems and circuit design. Experience with RF technologies. Strong mathematical skills and understanding of data processing. Experience in writing control software for test equipment. Experience in IDEs (Integrated Development Environment).', 'Leads software development efforts from pre-concept to production for medical devices. ', 'OUR CLIENT CANNOT PROVIDE SPONSORSHIP OR WORK CORP TO CORP.\xa0', '\xa0 ']

IBM servers and storage are no longer inanimate - they can understand, reason, and learn so our clients can innovate while avoiding IT issues. Our systems power the world’s most important industries and our clients are the architects of the future. Join us to help build our leading-edge technology portfolio designed for cognitive business and optimized for cloud computing.Your Life @ IBMWhat matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.Location StatementIBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for this position now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for this position, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.Being You @ IBMIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.', ' Deep z/OS administration knowledge.', ' Minimum 5 years’ experience in z/OS test, support or development, z/OS system programming, z/OS Assembler and PL/X']

job_title: Priority Period - Software Engineer Intern - Summer 2021
job_text: ['', "What You'll Need: ", 'You enjoy autonomy and the opportunity to make a project or tool on your own', 'You have strong written and verbal communication skills', ' You are currently enrolled in a full-time Bachelors or Masters degree program in Computer Science or related technical field and returning to a full-time degree program after completion of the internship.. You have experience with full stack and/or mobile development. You have knowledge and experience working with object oriented programming languages. You have experience or exposure to SQL, JavaScript and HTML. You have an interest in working with big data and machine learning You enjoy autonomy and the opportunity to make a project or tool on your own You have an ability to leverage problem solving and execution skills to make decisions and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity  You have strong written and verbal communication skills ', 'You will collaborate with business leaders and key stakeholders to brainstorm on how to solve the challenge', 'Enterprise Engineering: Builds and improves the software that directly impacts customers, customer service, sales, finance, talent management and external vendors. This team is responsible for all the tools and processes to support business critical operations at Wayfair, along with supporting the continued enhancement and scaling capabilities of these systems. ', 'Enterprise Engineering:', 'You have an ability to leverage problem solving and execution skills to make decisions and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity ', 'You have knowledge and experience working with object oriented programming languages.', 'You will work on individual and group projects focused on the full project life-cycle', 'We will help you improve your designs and jumpstart your learning ', " Storefront Web & Mobile App Engineering: We develop web and iOS/Android software solutions that provide a personalized world-class shopping experience for our millions of daily customers. We work in small, cross-functional agile teams to create an experience that is frictionless, tailored, and fluid. We bring Wayfair's millions of products to our customers' finger tips.  ", 'You will have accessibility to engineering leadership who want to hear your ideas', ' You will receive professional development training to improve your soft and hard skills ', "Storefront Web & Mobile App Engineering: We develop web and iOS/Android software solutions that provide a personalized world-class shopping experience for our millions of daily customers. We work in small, cross-functional agile teams to create an experience that is frictionless, tailored, and fluid. We bring Wayfair's millions of products to our customers' finger tips. ", 'Catalog Systems Engineering: Wayfair sells millions of products and this team owns all the data, tools, and systems that create and manage the content on the site related to each product. We build tools for our thousands of suppliers to send us content we need to be able to sell their products on site. This team makes sure the customer has the information she needs to be confident when purchasing for her home. Within Catalog, there are also teams such as pricing & competitive intelligence engineering, merchandising & media engineering, and virtual media.', 'You have experience or exposure to SQL, JavaScript and HTML.', 'Supply Chain Engineering: Develops the complex, ground-breaking logistics system to help move the products Wayfair sells from suppliers to warehouses to customers. Supply Chain is responsible for transportation, warehouse management, the Castlegate program, and the customer delivery network making it all possible.', 'Infrastructure and Platform Engineering: Responsible for the entire Wayfair website and all backend components that fuels and powers production. You can be an embedded engineer or a platform engineer. Embedded engineers work directly with engineering verticals to build and consult in building new initiatives. Platform engineers are subject matter experts and drive several initiatives. ', 'About Us: ', 'Infrastructure and Platform Engineering: ', 'Catalog Systems Engineering', ' You will have the opportunity to engage with other interns throughout the program and learn about various departments within the broader business. Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a team oriented fast paced, dynamic environment, with an acumen for helping to raise the bar for overall team performance. job_title: Priority Period - Software Engineer Intern - Summer 2021
job_text: ['', 'You enjoy autonomy and the opportunity to make a project or tool on your own', 'You have strong written and verbal communication skills', ' You are currently enrolled in a full-time Bachelors or Masters degree program in Computer Science or related technical field and returning to a full-time degree program after completion of the internship.. You have experience with full stack and/or mobile development. You have knowledge and experience working with object oriented programming languages. You have experience or exposure to SQL, JavaScript and HTML. You have an interest in working with big data and machine learning You enjoy autonomy and the opportunity to make a project or tool on your own You have an ability to leverage problem solving and execution skills to make decisions and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity  You have strong written and verbal communication skills ', 'You will collaborate with business leaders and key stakeholders to brainstorm on how to solve the challenge', 'Enterprise Engineering: Builds and improves the software that directly impacts customers, customer service, sales, finance, talent management and external vendors. This team is responsible for all the tools and processes to support business critical operations at Wayfair, along with supporting the continued enhancement and scaling capabilities of these systems. ', 'Enterprise Engineering:', 'You have an ability to leverage problem solving and execution skills to make decisions and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity ', 'Storefront Web & Mobile App Engineering: We develop web and iOS/Android software solutions that provide a personalized world-class shopping experience for our millions of daily customers. We work in small, cross-functional agile teams to create an experience that is frictionless, tailored, and fluid. We bring Wayfair’s millions of products to our customers’ finger tips. ', 'What You’ll Do', 'You have knowledge and experience working with object oriented programming languages.', 'You will work on individual and group projects focused on the full project life-cycle', 'We will help you improve your designs and jumpstart your learning ', 'What You’ll Need', ' You will receive professional development training to improve your soft and hard skills ', 'Catalog Systems Engineering: Wayfair sells millions of products and this team owns all the data, tools, and systems that create and manage the content on the site related to each product. We build tools for our thousands of suppliers to send us content we need to be able to sell their products on site. This team makes sure the customer has the information she needs to be confident when purchasing for her home. Within Catalog, there are also teams such as pricing & competitive intelligence engineering, merchandising & media engineering, and virtual media.', 'You will have accessibility to engineering leadership who want to hear your ideas', 'You have experience or exposure to SQL, JavaScript and HTML.', 'Supply Chain Engineering: Develops the complex, ground-breaking logistics system to help move the products Wayfair sells from suppliers to warehouses to customers. Platform engineers are subject matter experts and drive several initiatives. ', 'Infrastructure and Platform Engineering: ', 'Catalog Systems Engineering', ' You will have the opportunity to engage with other interns throughout the program and learn about various departments within the broader business. ', 'You will receive professional development training to improve your soft and hard skills', 'Storefront Web & Mobile App Engineering:', 'About Us', 'You Will Have The Opportunity To Work Within One Of The Following Groups', ' Supply Chain Engineering: Develops the complex, ground-breaking logistics system to help move the products Wayfair sells from suppliers to warehouses to customers. Ad Tech Systems and Customer Intelligence Engineering: Builds world class advertising & customer outreach technology to drive growth in a multi-billion dollar business using real-time tracking, personalization, and product recommendations to engage millions of new and returning customers. Enterprise Engineering: Builds and improves the software that directly impacts customers, customer service, sales, finance, talent management and external vendors. This team is responsible for all the tools and processes to support business critical operations at Wayfair, along with supporting the continued enhancement and scaling capabilities of these systems.  ', 'You will have the opportunity to engage with other interns throughout the program and learn about various departments within the broader business.', 'Ad Tech Systems and Customer Intelligence Engineering:', ' You will work on individual and group projects focused on the full project life-cycle You will collaborate with business leaders and key stakeholders to brainstorm on how to solve the challenge You will be exposed to a broad spectrum of technologies and programming languages We will help you improve your designs and jumpstart your learning  You will have accessibility to engineering leadership who want to hear your ideas ', ' Storefront Web & Mobile App Engineering: We develop web and iOS/Android software solutions that provide a personalized world-class shopping experience for our millions of daily customers. We work in small, cross-functional agile teams to create an experience that is frictionless, tailored, and fluid. We bring Wayfair’s millions of products to our customers’ finger tips.  ', 'You are currently enrolled in a full-time Bachelors or Masters degree program in Computer Science or related technical field and returning to a full-time degree program after completion of the internship..', 'You have an interest in working with big data and machine learning', 'Supply Chain Engineering', ' Catalog Systems Engineering: Wayfair sells millions of products and this team owns all the data, tools, and systems that create and manage the content on the site related to each product. ', ' Infrastructure and Platform Engineering: Responsible for the entire Wayfair website and all backend components that fuels and powers production. Platform engineers are subject matter experts and drive several initiatives.  ', 'Ad Tech Systems and Customer Intelligence Engineering: Builds world class advertising & customer outreach technology to drive growth in a multi-billion dollar business using real-time tracking, personalization, and product recommendations to engage millions of new and returning customers.', 'You will be exposed to a broad spectrum of technologies and programming languages', 'You have experience with full stack and/or mobile development.']

", ' Proficient with web technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS Experience with ReactJS is highly desired', ' Experience working within an Amazon Web Services (AWS) environment', ' Experience with RESTful API design & development', 'A Bit About Us', 'Why join us?', ' 4+ years of Software Development experience 2+ years of experience working on a consumer-facing SaaS or web-based application products Experience and/or willingness to participate in paired-programming (No Exceptions) Advanced with Python programming  Experience with Django or similar python web framework (Flask) Experience with RESTful API design & development Experience with RDBMs (PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases Experience working within an Amazon Web Services (AWS) environment Familiar with CI/CD and DevOps tools and best practices is highly desired', ' 4+ years of Software Development experience', ' Competitive Compensation Package!', 'Requirements', ' Tackle small bugs and features while performing root-cause analysis for bugs independently, escalating to other teammates when you need a second set of eyes. ', " Develop, maintain, and enhance our powerful SaaS platform Take ownership by creating your own technical specs because as a small team, you are given personal ownership of the planning processes. Collaborate a lot with each other and with product stakeholders.  Participate in the spec processes for new features and epics on our roadmap, and you'll help others resolve issues when they have questions about certain parts of the codebase that you've gained familiarity with.  Establish strong working relationships with individuals inside and outside of Engineering, and you'll have a clear understanding of both our customer journey and the workflows of our internal stakeholders. Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a team oriented fast paced, dynamic environment, with an acumen for helping to raise the bar for overall team performance. ', ' As a Senior Salesforce Engineer - you will work collaboratively across teams and/or independently to design and build solutions on the Salesforce Force.com platform, including Web Services APIs, Apex, and Visualforce. Experience with the Salesforce.com APEX data loader and other data loading tools.  Experience with Salesforce.com Web Services APIs - SOAP and REST-based Web Service APIs, including consumption, request packaging, parsing\\de-serializing, managing static values, and UI\\UX elements for working with data in returned API response payloads.  Demonstrated experience with integrating solutions between SFDC and external systems.  Detailed understanding of the Salesforce classic, Salesforce Lightning and Salesforce sandbox platform development environments, with Financial Services Cloud experience a plus.  Experience with Einstein Analytics, Einstein Discovery, and Marketing Cloud are all a plus.  Experience in Financial Services / Wealth Management is a plus.  Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a team oriented fast paced, dynamic environment, with an acumen for helping to raise the bar for overall team performance.  Experience with deployment/build/migration process in a Salesforce environment and associated tools.  Experience working in an agile delivery environment a plus. ['', 'Industry experience applying ML algorithms ', 'Participate in the design and implementation of all data science initiatives including ETL/data pipeline building and machine learning/forecasting systems. ', '4+ years experience as a Data Engineer ', 'Senior Data/ML Engineer ', 'Strong network in the NYC tech scene and ability to use relationships to recruit great talent ', 'Senior Data/ML Engineer', 'Strong Communication and Interpersonal skills ', 'BS in Computer Science or Applied Math ', 'Work cross-functionally with business teams. Collaborate with product to decompose requirements into technical tasks. ', 'Be cognizant of cost-of-service models to understand the financial cost of serving our customers, identify ways to drive efficiencies from our stack. ', 'As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be creating an energy management platform that is a first of its kind. The role reports to the CTO and will be located at our HQ in our Brooklyn, NY offices. ', 'Our success will depend on aggregating and analyzing data to properly dispatch and manage users’ assets (such as battery storage, HVAC, and solar) in real-time energy markets to provide the customer with the most value possible. We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who can spearhead the development of our data/ETL pipelines as well as some basic machine learning algorithms. ', ' Minimum Qualifications:', 'Familiar with or able to learn quickly about building systems and IoT sensors, their data, and analysis of it (HVAC, occupancy, temperature, energy meters, etc.) ', 'Accountability-minded. Can create a culture of healthy accountability in the team. Can balance code quality and speed to market. Been through a startup before', ' ', 'The ideal candidate will be a passionate and hands on leader who wants to build the foundations of a world class software organization. We want someone with an innate curiosity who would enjoy getting up to speed on energy quickly in order to approach this sector in a new way. ', 'Responsibilities include:', 'Unify data from building systems, sensors, APIs, and other sources; design and build a database solution for analyzing key performance indicators (KPIs) in the energy sector. ', '4+ years experience as a Data Engineer Industry experience applying ML algorithms Strong Communication and Interpersonal skills Passion for designing and delivering mission critical code and products BS in Computer Science or Applied Math ', 'Recruit, mentor, inspire and develop engineering teams in New York. Set goals and manage the performance of the overall ML team ', 'Build models and programs to predict building demand and onsite energy generation through analysis of data from building management system, weather, and other similar systems to aid in reducing energy consumption. ', 'Own engineering process to maximize velocity and code quality. Define the engineering organization, best practices, estimation, manage technical risk and debt, and own project management for the data/ML team. ', 'MS/PhD in Computer Science or Applied Math ', ' Preferred Qualifications:', 'Assist in writing algorithms to properly dispatch assets such as batteries based on energy market signals and predicted user energy demand. ', 'Passion for designing and delivering mission critical code and products ', 'Oversee set up and maintenance of backend cloud infrastructure. ', 'Participate in the design and implementation of all data science initiatives including ETL/data pipeline building and machine learning/forecasting systems. Build models and programs to predict building demand and onsite energy generation through analysis of data from building management system, weather, and other similar systems to aid in reducing energy consumption. Oversee set up and maintenance of backend cloud infrastructure. Work cross-functionally with business teams. Collaborate with product to decompose requirements into technical tasks. Assist in writing algorithms to properly dispatch assets such as batteries based on energy market signals and predicted user energy demand. Unify data from building systems, sensors, APIs, and other sources; design and build a database solution for analyzing key performance indicators (KPIs) in the energy sector. Be cognizant of cost-of-service models to understand the financial cost of serving our customers, identify ways to drive efficiencies from our stack. Own engineering process to maximize velocity and code quality. Define the engineering organization, best practices, estimation, manage technical risk and debt, and own project management for the data/ML team. Recruit, mentor, inspire and develop engineering teams in New York. Can create a culture of healthy accountability in the team. Can balance code quality and speed to market. Been through a startup before', 'Our firm is creating a new kind of energy company. Traditional Retail Electricity Providers are outdated, opaque, and painful for customers to engage with. We are using software driven solutions to create an entirely new way of doing business in this space and build a category defining company. Our mission is to give energy customers greater transparency and control while creating a cheaper, cleaner, more reliable electricity grid. ']

['', 'Experience building massively distributed systems, modeling financial data, or building intuitive, feature-rich user interfaces.', 'B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science or similar technical field of study (or equivalent practical experience.). ', 'A passion for implementing best practices and a bias toward smart automation. ', '5+ years experience as a professional software engineer. ', 'Requirements', 'Proven ability to collaborate with and mentor other engineers. ', 'B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science or similar technical field of study (or equivalent practical experience.). 5+ years experience as a professional software engineer. A passion for implementing best practices and a bias toward smart automation. Proven ability to collaborate with and mentor other engineers. Experience building massively distributed systems, modeling financial data, or building intuitive, feature-rich user interfaces.', "Our company is building a single platform unifying hundreds of portfolio and market data systems and leveraging that platform to create robust, powerful financial applications.The technical effort involved is massive. Our engineering builds portfolio data ingestion systems that process tens of millions of transactions across millions of accounts every day, and pricing and reference data systems that provide coverage for over a trillion dollars in assets. We build and run our own distributing serving and financial calculation framework that allows clients to run complex analysis of massive data sets in real time. We design robust APIs and powerful, versatile user interfaces to empower wealth managers to ask nuanced questions about their clients' holdings.The group you’ll be joining includes senior engineers and leads who have worked at companies like Facebook, Google, LinkedIn, DE Shaw, Two Sigma, and other top software firms and quantitative hedge funds. If you've designed complex scalable systems, built powerful and intuitive user interfaces, or worked with great teams on hard problems in financial data, come join us.Our engineering team works in Java, Python, and Javascript, but we don’t require prior experience with any specific tool set. Great software engineers can pick up new languages on the job. More than checking the boxes on specific technologies, we're looking for driven engineers with real technical depth and a desire to understand the end business. We want people who are passionate and care deeply about the success of the whole company.The problems we’re tackling at our company are complex, but they’re also globally important. Our platform and our company has the potential to make a huge swath of private investing more transparent, more efficient, and more ethical. If you’re interested in that, we’re excited to meet you.Requirements", 'Software Engineer']

['You have the skills to take initiative and the self-motivation to drive results. ', 'Responsible for identifying and building technologies, practices, and tools that enable application builders to build. ', 'You are experienced in distributed system design and implementation, and the ability to ensure high-performance, high-reliability operation of large-scale systems. ', 'We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, and a technology innovation lab. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities. ', '\xa0', 'You have built and debugged J2EE applications on one or more runtime implementations such as WebSphere, Jboss, or Tomcat. ', 'Role:', 'You are high-energy, detail-oriented, proactive and adaptive and can work in a dynamic environment. ', 'Overview: ', 'You are an experienced user or one or more Application Lifecycle Management tools (e.g., Rally, Jira). ', 'You have experience with development of large scale distributed systems including consensus mechanisms, partitioning and sharding, and reliability engineering. ', 'You are experienced with DevOps, and test automation. ', 'Overview: We are recruiting Senior Software Engineers to drive software engineering practice improvement initiatives across multiple engineering teams, enabling them to delight customers by building higher quality software, faster.This team will drive engineering excellence by identifying technologies, building tools, and growing great development and design practices. We will also create tools to help teams and management understand progress and measure success. The mission of this team is simply to build a continuously improving world-class software engineering culture for our company. • Are you passionate about the practice of software engineering?• Are you fanatical about large scale, distributed systems the right way?• Are you a tool builder?• Do you want to help software engineers to build better quality software faster?• Do you firmly believe that code talks, and just about anything else walks?  Role: ', '\xa0 ', 'You are a highly proficient Java developer with solid foundations in Java language philosophy and JVM implementations. ', 'About You:', 'You have Software Engineering expertise in the application of various R&D tools. ', 'You are an engineer’s engineer – a recognized go-to resource for “how to do it right” in software engineering. ', 'Job Title: Senior Software Engineer, Builder Tools and Methods ', 'Willingness and ability to learn and take on challenging opportunities and to work as a member of a diverse and geographically distributed team. ', 'You are known for writing crisp and clean documentation. ', ' ', 'You are a Git expert, and have experience with one or more SCM hosting tools such as GitHub or BitBucket. ', 'You are experienced with CI/CD, and even better you have built CI/CD tools and pipelines. ', 'You possess strong communication skills -- both verbal and written – and strong relationship, collaborative skills and organizational skills. ', 'Senior Software Engineer, Builder Tools and Methods\xa0 ', 'Mentor team members within the group. ', 'You have expert level knowledge of software development processes, and you practice Agile at an advanced level. ', 'Developing wide range of tools to fetch data from code repositories, generate metrics/graphs and provide valuable analysis. ', 'Hands-on technical leader who brings considerable experience with application-layer development for both web and mobile web applications, using a broad range of technologies. Responsible for identifying and building technologies, practices, and tools that enable application builders to build. Collaborate with different groups within the organization, identify best practices, and evangelize those across other organizations. Conduct demos, training, tech-talks, participate in technical reviews and drive excellence. Developing wide range of tools to fetch data from code repositories, generate metrics/graphs and provide valuable analysis. Mentor team members within the group. \xa0 About You: You are an engineer’s engineer – a recognized go-to resource for “how to do it right” in software engineering. You are high-energy, detail-oriented, proactive and adaptive and can work in a dynamic environment. You have the skills to take initiative and the self-motivation to drive results. You possess strong communication skills -- both verbal and written – and strong relationship, collaborative skills and organizational skills. Willingness and ability to learn and take on challenging opportunities and to work as a member of a diverse and geographically distributed team. You are known for writing crisp and clean documentation. You are experienced in distributed system design and implementation, and the ability to ensure high-performance, high-reliability operation of large-scale systems. You have Software Engineering expertise in the application of various R&D tools. You have experience designing, implementing, and driving quality improvement of large-scale software. You have expert level knowledge of software development processes, and you practice Agile at an advanced level. You have experience and knowledge of Test Driven and Domain Driven Development (TDD / DDD), including using automated test frameworks (e.g., Junit). You have built and debugged J2EE applications on one or more runtime implementations such as WebSphere, Jboss, or Tomcat. You are a highly proficient Java developer with solid foundations in Java language philosophy and JVM implementations. You have experience with development of large scale distributed systems including consensus mechanisms, partitioning and sharding, and reliability engineering. You are an experienced user or one or more Application Lifecycle Management tools (e.g., Rally, Jira). You are a Git expert, and have experience with one or more SCM hosting tools such as GitHub or BitBucket. You are experienced with DevOps, and test automation. You are experienced with CI/CD, and even better you have built CI/CD tools and pipelines. ', 'You have experience and knowledge of Test Driven and Domain Driven Development (TDD / DDD), including using automated test frameworks (e.g., Junit). ', 'Senior Software Engineer, Builder Tools and Methods', 'Job Title: ', 'Senior Software Engineer, Builder Tools and Methods\xa0', 'About You: ', 'Conduct demos, training, tech-talks, participate in technical reviews and drive excellence. ', 'New York City, New York ', 'You have experience designing, implementing, and driving quality improvement of large-scale software. ', 'Hands-on technical leader who brings considerable experience with application-layer development for both web and mobile web applications, using a broad range of technologies. ', 'Collaborate with different groups within the organization, identify best practices, and evangelize those across other organizations. ']

['', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Large software systems design, development, testing, and maintenance.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Systems programming: systems-level programming and hacking operating systems (especially Linux).', 'Systems Software Engineer', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Programming languages: C/C++ on Linux', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a comparable technical discipline', 'As an employer, we are small, discreet, and highly selective. We look for exceptional people with proven track records of performance and achievement. We are far more interested in aptitude and potential than expertise in any particular technology, tool set, or professional domain. If working on interesting problems with talented colleagues inspires you, we invite you to share your resume and explore the possibility of joining our team.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Development and support of real-time operations and critical production systems.', 'For over three decades, the QS team has built quantitative trading systems that have produced exceptional results across a range of financial markets. We use scientific methods and engineering discipline to solve challenging problems and develop technology solutions. Our office is as unique as our location, combining elements of high tech, finance, and applied research in a collegial atmosphere and beautiful workspace.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Expertise building low-level systems or components that require a relentless focus on quality and reliability (such as kernels, operating systems, file systems, hypervisors, VMMs, large scale distributed systems, core database platforms, or similar).', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Experience developing multi-threaded or shared memory systems.', 'Specific skills and experience will include a combination of the following:', 'At QS, at-scale computing is core to what we do, and systems-oriented software engineers are an essential part of our team.\xa0We seek highly skilled engineers who can work effectively with others, have strong problem-solving skills, and pay attention to details. Our hierarchy is uncommonly flat, and we have few meetings, so a premium is placed on self-motivated people who can collaborate effectively and deliver great individual results.\xa0']

['', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Large software systems design, development, testing, and maintenance.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Systems programming: systems-level programming and hacking operating systems (especially Linux).', 'Systems Software Engineer', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Programming languages: C/C++ on Linux', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a comparable technical discipline', 'As an employer, we are small, discreet, and highly selective. We look for exceptional people with proven track records of performance and achievement. We are far more interested in aptitude and potential than expertise in any particular technology, tool set, or professional domain. If working on interesting problems with talented colleagues inspires you, we invite you to share your resume and explore the possibility of joining our team.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Development and support of real-time operations and critical production systems.', 'For over three decades, the QS team has built quantitative trading systems that have produced exceptional results across a range of financial markets. We use scientific methods and engineering discipline to solve challenging problems and develop technology solutions. Our office is as unique as our location, combining elements of high tech, finance, and applied research in a collegial atmosphere and beautiful workspace.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Expertise building low-level systems or components that require a relentless focus on quality and reliability (such as kernels, operating systems, file systems, hypervisors, VMMs, large scale distributed systems, core database platforms, or similar).', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Experience developing multi-threaded or shared memory systems.', 'Specific skills and experience will include a combination of the following:', 'At QS, at-scale computing is core to what we do, and systems-oriented software engineers are an essential part of our team.\xa0We seek highly skilled engineers who can work effectively with others, have strong problem-solving skills, and pay attention to details. Our hierarchy is uncommonly flat, and we have few meetings, so a premium is placed on self-motivated people who can collaborate effectively and deliver great individual results.\xa0']
